channel.title: 317 Command Help
channel.description: Hello i need help with this command: A command that you need 99 prayer and 99 attack to be able to do it, if you dont have that you cant do the command, and if you have 99 attack and prayer and do the command it resets you prayer and attack to level 1.

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Read this page, it should help you out a lot. Chances are you will run into some more errors if you keep trying to compile that example code I posted because you probably don’t have any variables named “____SkillIdHere” either.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @bajset bajset
item.description:
@bajset wrote:

[quote=“N_A, post:10, topic:550687”]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("cmd_name_here")) { if (playerLevel[attackSkillIdHere] > 99 && playerLevel[prayerSkillIdHere] > 99) { resetSkill(attackSkillIdHere); resetSkill(prayerSkillIdHere); } else { sM("You don't have the required skills to use this command."); return; } } Here’s a basic idea of how it might look like; however, I would not copy and paste that directly into your source because chances are you won’t have methods named exactly like that or they might not even exist on a blank source.
[/quote]

I dont think I have those methods, Can you teach me how to add them?

client.java:7126: cannot find symbol
symbol : method resetSkill(int)
location: class client
resetSkill(0);
^
client.java:7127: cannot find symbol
symbol : method resetSkill(int)
location: class client
resetSkill(4);
^
2 errors

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("cmd_name_here")) { if (playerLevel[attackSkillIdHere] > 99 && playerLevel[prayerSkillIdHere] > 99) { resetSkill(attackSkillIdHere); resetSkill(prayerSkillIdHere); } else { sM("You don't have the required skills to use this command."); return; } } Here’s a basic idea of how it might look like; however, I would not copy and paste that directly into your source because chances are you won’t have methods named exactly like that or they might not even exist on a blank source.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @bajset bajset
item.description:
@bajset wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:550687”]Well, not to be rude, but you’d tweak where the errors are.

You gave us very little information on your server. I get it’s a 317, but there’s more than 1 317 base out there (Asteria, RuneSource, Delta, ProjectInsanity, Hyperion, to name some).

If you want better help, you’re going to have to provide better information. Take a look at the first link in my signature, it has a few tips on posting a more helpful post so we can provide you with more quality help.

Also, you said you’re new to this. I recommend the Java tutorials by Oracle:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/ <The main tutorial index
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/getStarted/index.html < The “start” of the tutorials.
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/reallybigindex.html < All of the tutorials by Oracle.[/quote]
I’m sure you need more info than this… but anyways the codes looks simular to this one “sM(“This is a send message in delta!”);” and also its a blank source and client so im not sure what base it was original

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well, not to be rude, but you’d tweak where the errors are.

You gave us very little information on your server. I get it’s a 317, but there’s more than 1 317 base out there (Asteria, RuneSource, Delta, ProjectInsanity, Hyperion, to name some).

If you want better help, you’re going to have to provide better information. Take a look at the first link in my signature, it has a few tips on posting a more helpful post so we can provide you with more quality help.

Also, you said you’re new to this. I recommend the Java tutorials by Oracle:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/ <The main tutorial index
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/getStarted/index.html < The “start” of the tutorials.
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/reallybigindex.html < All of the tutorials by Oracle.

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @bajset bajset
item.description:
@bajset wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:6, topic:550687”][quote author=bajset link=topic=669599.msg4477535#msg4477535 date=1427046304]

Hello i need help with this command: A command that you need 99 prayer and 99 attack to be able to do it, if you dont have that you cant do the command, and if you have 99 attack and prayer and do the command it resets you prayer and attack to level 1.

					if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) {
		if (c.playerLevel[0] > 99) {
			c.sendMessage("There are currently " +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online.");
		} else {
			c.sendMessage("You need 99 attack to use this command.");
           }
}

What lol?

@OP

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("reset")) {
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
player.sendMessage("You can't use this command.");
return;
}
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });
player.sendMessage("Your prayer and attack have been reset");
}

May need a few tweaks for your base

I get this error:

client.java:7125: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable player
location: class client
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
^
client.java:7125: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable PRAYER
location: class Player
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
^
client.java:7125: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable player
location: class client
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
^
client.java:7125: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable ATTACK
location: class Player
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
^
client.java:7126: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable player
location: class client
player.sendMessage(“You can’t use this command.”);
^
client.java:7129: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable PRAYER
location: class Player
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });
^
client.java:7129: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable ATTACK
location: class Player
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });
^
client.java:7129: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable player
location: class client
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });
^
client.java:7130: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable player
location: class client
player.sendMessage(“Your prayer and attack have been reset”);
^
9 errors

Could you help me? Thanks
[/quote]

May need a few tweaks for your base

This won’t work if you just put it in…[/quote]

I’m kinda new to this, I’m not sure where to tweak

Read full topic

					if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) {

			c.sendMessage("There are currently " +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online.");

}

if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
player.sendMessage("You can't use this command.");
return;
}
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });

item.title: 317 Command Help
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“Project Runescape, post:2, topic:550687”][quote author=bajset link=topic=669599.msg4477510#msg4477510 date=1427025452]
Hello i need help with this command: A command that you need 99 prayer and 99 attack to be able to do it, if you dont have that you cant do the command, and if you have 99 attack and prayer and do the command it resets you prayer and attack to level 1.
[/quote]
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)) {
if (c.playerLevel[0] > 99) {
c.sendMessage(“There are currently " +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ " players online.”);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You need 99 attack to use this command.”);
}
}[/quote]

What lol?

@OP

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("reset")) {
if (player.levels[Player.PRAYER] < 99 || player.levels[Player.ATTACK] < 99) {
player.sendMessage("You can't use this command.");
return;
}
player.resetStat(new int[] { Player.PRAYER, Player.ATTACK });
player.sendMessage("Your prayer and attack have been reset");
}

May need a few tweaks for your base

Read full topic
